A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Rian Johnson pulls off a hell of trick with the The Last Jedi. It answers all questions\, it blows up the mythology\, but it does so by saying “none of that is important”. The trick is that having realized what he has done you feel like you should be infuriated...but your not. You feel a bit odd about it perhaps\, but no sense of loss. In way there really are no spoilers for this film\, because nothing happens the way you might imagine. It is a narrative hand grenade. At the end the new cast is completely free to go in any direction without having to pull the weight of what has gone before. It is entertaining\, but it will play with your expectations.
